raw_text:
Tory expert denies defeat warning
 
 The Conservatives' campaign director has denied a report claiming he warned Michael Howard the party could not win the next general election.
 
 The Times on Monday said Australian Lynton Crosby told the party leader to focus on trying to increase the Tories' Commons presence by 25 to 30 seats. But Mr Crosby said in a statement: "I have never had any such conversation... and I do not hold that view." Mr Howard later added there was not "one iota" of truth in the report. The strategist helped Australia's PM, John Howard, win four elections. Mr Howard appointed Mr Crosby as his elections chief last October. Mr Crosby's statement said: "The Conservative Party has been making an impact on the issues of lower tax and controlled immigration over the past week." It added: "The Labour Party will be wanting to do all they can to distract attention away from the issues that really matter to people."
llama3.2:1b: Conservatives' campaign director, Tory expert denies warning Michael Howard not to fight next election.

Mr Crosby says he never made such a statement and that an Australian PM's strategist told him the party should focus on increasing its presence in parliament rather than focusing solely on issues of lower taxes and immigration.
llama3.2:3b: Conservatives' campaign director Lynton Crosby denies a report claiming he told Michael Howard the party could not win the next general election, and claims his views have never been held.
Mr Crosby helped Australia's PM win four elections and stated that the Conservative Party has been making an impact on key issues, while saying Labour will try to distract from these.
gemma2:2b: Tory campaign director denies report claiming he warned Michael Howard the party could not win the next election.
Crosby says he never had such a conversation and doesn't hold that view.
Howard confirms there is no truth in the report.
Crosby also states the Conservative Party has been making an impact on issues of lower tax and controlled immigration recently, while adding Labour will try to distract from these key points.
qwen2.5:0.5b: Criticizing Tory candidate Michael Howard's warning, Tories' campaign director Tory expert denied a report alleging he warned the party would not win the next general election.
qwen2.5:1.5b: Conservative campaign director denies previous claim he warned Michael Howard about party's inability to win next election.
qwen2.5:3b: Tory campaign director Lynton Crosby denies warning Michael Howard about Conservative's inability to win next election.
Crosby said he advised focusing on increasing party's Commons presence by 25-30 seats.
He maintains no such conversation occurred and there is no truth in the report.
Previously, John Howard appointed Crosby as his elections chief.
Crosby claims Conservatives are addressing issues of lower taxes and immigration control.
He believes Labour will attempt to divert attention from key concerns.

Mr Howard later added that he had not made a single point of truth in the report.
The Australian PM John Howard has won four elections."

The expert says Lynton's statement isn't likely to fail, as it's critical for election results.

However, Lynton denied the conversation and didn't hold that view.
Howard later accused the report of being fake, adding no truth to it.

Lynton criticized Labour for wanting distraction, pointing out Conservative issues like lower taxes and immigration align with everyday concerns, while Labour wants to divert attention from these matters.

Howard later added that the strategist helped Australia's PM win four elections.
tinydolphin:1.1b: Tory expert denies defeat warning, claiming it is part of a Liberal-leaned campaign strategy.
The Conservatives' campaign director has denied a report suggesting he warned Michael Howard about losing the next general election to the Liberal Party.
This suggests there may be some disagreement or confusion between Mr. Crosby and his boss, who appointed him as elections chief last October.
The strategist for Australia's Prime Minister, John Howard, has been leading the Conservatives' charge in winning four elections under his leadership.

granite3.1-dense:2b: Lynton Crosby, Michael Howard's campaign director, refutes a report claiming he foretold the Conservatives' inability to win the next general election.
The Times alleged Crosby advised focusing on expanding the party's Commons seats by 25 to 30.
In his statement, Crosby denied ever having such a conversation and expressed no such belief.
He emphasized the Conservatives' impact on key issues like lower taxes and controlled immigration.
Howard echoed these denials, stating there was "no truth" in the report.
Crosby, known for his role in John Howard's four Australian election victories, was appointed as the Conservatives' campaign chief last October.
His statement also suggested that Labour would try to divert attention from crucial issues.
